page.title: 05SHOPS AND TRADE
page.content: THERE ARE NO SHOPS IN BROTHERTOFT THE AREA IS NOT LARGE ENOUGH TO WARRANT A SHOP.THE NEAREST SHOP IS AT LANGRICK JUST BY THE BRIDGE.THE SHOP HOLDS A SMALL SELECTION OF MOST THINGS.NEXT DOOR TO THE SHOP IS A GARAGE WHICH REPAIRS MOST OF THE LOCAL CARS.A PETROL STATION STANDS BY THE BRIDGE THE TRADE IS ONLY LOCAL.JUST OVER THE BRIDGE IS A CAFE THIS IS USED BY LORRY DRIVERS PASSING THROUGH THE AREA,THE BUILDING WAS A LARGE HOUSE WHICH HAS NOW BEEN CONVERTED.THE ONLY PUBLIC HOUSE IN THE AREA IS CALLED THE FERRY BOAT INN,THIS GOT ITS NAME FROM WHEN THERE WAS NO BRIDGE A MAN WAS EMPLOYED TO FERRY PEOPLE ACROSS THE RIVER.THE PUB IS USED BY PEOPLE FROM OUT THE AREA. JUST ON FROM THERE IS A VERY SMALL SHOWROOM FOR CARS IT ONLY HAS ENOUGH ROOM FOR FOUR CARS.
